channel.title: Help running a server
channel.description:
THIS IS HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH PORT FORWARDING, I BELIEVE IT IS A FIREWALL. I AM NOT NEW TO HOSTING+SCRIPTING BUT THIS HASN'T HAPPENED BEFORE.
This has been a problem since I brought a router for the computer but, when I run the server only I can connect using ip: 0.0.0.0, the no-ip addresses I created don't let poeple connect. My computer can connect to it but no-one else can. Also note that, I can't connect with my computer using the no-ip.
I have done everything, since it worked before the router, I even port-forwarded the new router, so there should be no problems there. I have created a no-ip address but no one can connect to it still.
Can anyone possibly tell me what could be wrong, so I can fix it?
Thanks
Sam

item.title: Help running a server
item.dc:creator: @miyu_miyu5 miyu miyu5
item.description:
@miyu_miyu5 wrote:

ok, check ur firewall turn it off, or make an exception try to portfoward again, and if u cant use utorrent instead of portforwarding.

Read full topic

item.title: Help running a server
item.dc:creator: @ginger_ninja ginger_ninja
item.description:
@ginger_ninja wrote:

THIS IS HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH PORT FORWARDING, I BELIEVE IT IS A FIREWALL.
I AM NOT NEW TO HOSTING+SCRIPTING BUT THIS HASN’T HAPPENED BEFORE.

This has been a problem since I brought a router for the computer but, when I run the server only I can connect using ip: 0.0.0.0, the no-ip addresses I created don’t let poeple connect. My computer can connect to it but no-one else can. Also note that, I can’t connect with my computer using the no-ip.

I have done everything, since it worked before the router, I even port-forwarded the new router, so there should be no problems there.
I have created a no-ip address but no one can connect to it still.

Can anyone possibly tell me what could be wrong, so I can fix it?

Thanks

Sam
